artists.name: Chris While & Julie Matthews
artists.summary: Chris While and Julie Matthews’ musical partnership began in 1993 when they were key members of the legendary folk super-group The Albion Band. In 1997 they left the band to concentrate on their work as a duo which has seen them tour throughout the world and gain an ever growing devoted fan-base. Their songs have been covered by a range of artists including Mary Black, Barbara Dickson, Christine Collister and Fairport Convention.

artists.name: Gordie MacKeeman & his Rhythm Boys
artists.summary: Gordie MacKeeman exemplifies the term natural showman. An ace fiddle player nicknamed “crazy legs” for his frenetic loose-limbed step- dancing, he just loves to perform. Combine that exuberance and onstage dynamism with the stellar musicianship of his multi-instrumentalist comrades His Rhythm Boys, and you have an unstoppable roots music force

artists.name: Ten Strings and A Goat Skin
artists.summary: Transforming tradition with vigour, curiosity, humour and spark, this trio from Prince Edward Island wielding bodhrÃ¡n, acoustic guitar and violin plays seamless, polished, barrel-drum-tight, rhythmically innovative and wildly entertaining music. Traditional and original music inspired by their Atlantic Canadian histories and roots, and infused with infectious rhythms.

artists.name: Elephant Sessions
artists.summary: 2017 was a remarkable year for Elephant Sessions. The band who hail from the Highlands of Scotland and who met at the Newcastle University Folk degree have exploded onto the indie folk scene with unparalleled effect. The release of their award winning album in June, was followed by live appearances at some of Europe’s most notable festivals. Audiences crowd surfed their way through the summer and marquee floors broke under the weight of bouncing fans.

artists.name: The Good Lovelies
artists.summary: Funny, upbeat, with just a pinch of sass, this Juno award-winning Canadian trio delights with their uplifting three-part harmonies and light-hearted song writing. Wielding mandolin, acoustic guitars and banjo, their witty on-stage banter and constant instrument swapping have been charming audiences all over the world.

artists.name: Lindsay Lou
artists.summary: As a vocalist, Lindsay Lou falls into an elite category, along with her band of equally gifted musicians playing their own brand of Americana, Lindsay Lou is a not to be missed act on the festival stage.

artists.name: Corin Raymond
artists.summary: This Canadian songwriter's love of words began in the car with his father, driving the jack-pined distances of Northern Ontario. His father would tell him Greek myths to pass the time, and thus began a lifelong love affair with words that set him on the path to becoming songwriter and student of songcraft. With Corinâ€™s latest album, JUNO nominated Hobo Jungle Fever Dreams, he's created his finest collection yet.

artists.name: Bohemian Nights
artists.summary: Ernie Gruner (violin, mandolin) and Phil Carroll (vocals, accordion, ney ) play Gypsy, Klezmer, Middle-Eastern, French, Italian, Russian, jazz and tango music ranging from soulful to wild. 15 years of festivals around Australia and New Zealand, and 2 CDs. 'Loads of enthusiasm, brilliant musicality' – director Wellington Folk Festival

artists.name: Guyy & the Fox
artists.summary: Guitar meets violin in this mesmerising & captivating duo. Award winning musician Guy Lilleyman & Amelia Gibson join forces to offer an eclectic performance ranging from folk ballads to soaring instrumentals & everything in between!

artists.name: The Coconut Kids
artists.summary: Infectiously fun, The Coconut Kids are friends from Adelaide that defy genres to create French-influenced world folk using ukulele, brass, mandolin, violin, rhythm and cheeky power vocals. These coco nuts went from a duo jamming around kitchen tables and campfires to playing as an 8-piece at interstate festivals to showcasing their work in Texas within 18 months. Their unique sound will have you dancing one minute, in tears the next

artists.name: The Northern Folk
artists.summary: The Northern Folk are a collective of eleven musical ambitionists spreading their unique brand of folk/pop/rock into the roots of small towns and big cities alike. Led by two lead vocalists and roaring horns, their big sound is continuing to earn them a following wherever they travel.

artists.name: The Young Folk
artists.summary: The Young Folk represent the new world of Irish music. Young and funky but with a lifeblood of tradition that gives homage to heritage, people and place their music represents the evolution of history and culture in a contemporary context.

artists.name: Pete Denahy
artists.summary: Pete Denahy released a comedy album in 2014 featuring songs about over use of mobile phones, selfies, food & flatulence. The songs have delighted & disgusted a wide range of people, which seems to suit Denahy. He’s also written songs about Yackandandah in the gold rush days & beyond, which feature on his latest bluegrass albums Wishbone Road and Singin' Shoes.

artists.name: David Ross Macdonald
artists.summary: Son of an ex jazz trumpeter dentist who ditched geology to fail at jazz college to take up washboard to join The Waifs over a Port Fairy Guinness who fell in love with a 1935 Gibson guitar while touring the USA with Bob Dylan to writing songs and riffing stories to anyone who cared to listen.

artists.name: Gina Williams and Guy Ghouse
artists.summary: Gina Williams and Guy Ghouse will capture your hearts through songs and storytelling in rare Noongar (Aboriginal) language. Combining guitar brilliance and incandescent vocals it’s an extraordinary musical journey.

artists.name: Ukulele Death Squad
artists.summary: Exploding onto the scene in February 2017 at the Adelaide Fringe Festival, they blend their own ukulele style with Flamenco, Mexican, rap and Folk, with an energetic performance that goes beyond anything audiences have ever seen. The Death Squad have already managed to achieve sold-out Adelaide & Edinburgh Fringe Festival Seasons in 2017. In fact they have sold out every single show to this day. The UDS will warp your perceptions of ukuleles one nylon string at a time With stage-craft, mad thumping rhythms and outrageous solos, they will quite literally blow your minds. Enter at your own risk.

artists.name: The Timbers
artists.summary: The Timbers' thumping rhythms and big misty mountain melodies will cast you away to a sweaty, smoky, melting-pot of folk, roots and Celtic bushman brassy punk. They rollick and hammer their way through live gigs with abundant energy and have become festival favourites throughout Australia. This Adelaide based band has an infectious desire to take their audience on a wild ride of non stop musical passion

artists.name: Bruce Watson
artists.summary: Not just another singer songwriter! Bruce is an icon of the folk scene, a major songwriter and performer. He has won a swag of awards and had songs covered by many performers including Eric Bogle. His songs are joyful, thought provoking, totally engaging – reflecting life, ordinary people, and the big issues, often with a twist and a quirky sense of humour.

artists.name: Lady Valiant
artists.summary: Lady Valiant are a Blues/Folk act with attitude. Formed in the United States and based in Far North Queensland this duo base their sound around lead singer Glenna Lynes' raw soulful bluesy voice. It carries some serious weight. Mixed this some driving stomp box and well placed dirty slide guitar and you have the Lady Valiant recipe.

artists.name: The Good Girl Song Project
artists.summary: In this theatre-based song cycle, seven of Australia’s leading folk musicians recount a voyage taken by young women to Australia in the 1830’s. A must see new work that combines old fashioned storytelling and new Celtic-flavoured songs. The group will be launching their new CD at the Festival.

artists.name: Yoga Loves Music
artists.summary: THEY'RE BACK! Imagine a yoga practice, merged with live music, humour, playfulness and connection. Step into a soulful blend of contemporary grooves, weaved with traditional mantras and paired with heart wisdom. A workshop combination of live sound and a yoga practice fuelled on waves of vibrational soundscapes & collective breath, invoking the highest connection to our true essence and awakening of mojo!

artists.name: John Flanagan Trio
artists.summary: John's engaging lyricism, uplifting melodies and warm vocal timbre have seen him draw comparisons to James Taylor and Paul Kelly and described as a 'songwriting force'

artists.name: Laura Hill
artists.summary: Thousands of purling whispers have revealed one of Australiaâ€™s most beautiful secrets - Laura Hill. A singer-songwriter in the great traditions of the craft: fearless, inventive, evocative and honest. A voice that has to be heard to be believed.

artists.name: Tom Richardson
artists.summary: With an infectious and genuine demeanor, Tom's songwriting, story telling and intricate guitar playing are a delicate balance of grace, truth and passion. At a live performance, it's not uncommon to experience people laughing, crying, dancing and singing. Renowned as a 'maestro'.

artists.name: Knott Family Band
artists.summary: The Knott Family Band's brand of bluegrass features four-part harmony and lyricism reflecting traditional and lived storytelling on top of their string-band arrangement. With members connecting from Melbourne and rural Victoria, they play bluegrass-infused songs that reflect traditional and contemporary influences from Bill Monroe to The Punch Brothers.

artists.name: William Alexander
artists.summary: William Alexander or 'The Kid From Bourke', has a deep set passion for old songs. Songs written in a time when things were tough and things were simple. William spends his time roaming the bush with his wife archiving and performing forgotten ballads.

artists.name: Imogen Pemberton
artists.summary: Singer-songwriter Imogen Pemberton mesmerises with lush vocals, soaring melodies and sophisticated guitar playing. Her debut EP 'Spine' (2016) captured her own unique vision with folk ballads that are haunting, heartfelt and raw. Together with cellist Oliver Downes, Imogen conjures soundscapes to break the heart and nourish the soul.

artists.name: Rachel Clark
artists.summary: A self-taught Singer-Songwriter, Rachel Clark delivers a heart-felt and intimate combination of music and story-telling; With a vibe of soulful acoustic folk and in a bare-all honesty, telling stories of loss, love and the battles fought within ourselves.

artists.name: Mariah McCarthy
artists.summary: Originating in small country town Heathcote, folk singer/songwriter Mariah McCarthy made the move to Melbourne four years ago and quickly gained recognition in the folk scene with her duo Deer Prudence. Mariah now embarks on her future work as a solo musician producing intimate, thought provoking songs, which delicately tell stories of love and loss. Mariah's debut EP is set for release in 2018.

artists.name: New Flamenco Project
artists.summary: Flamenco dancing with fierce footwork together with castanetes and shawl accompanying guitar and vocals.

artists.name: The Blue Yonder
artists.summary: The Blue Yonder are a 5 piece homespun indie folk rock band from North East Victoria, whose soaring originals and tasty harmonies evoke panoramic images of the Australian landscape that's guaranteed to feed an empty dance floor.

artists.name: Marisa Quigley
artists.summary: Marisa Quigley is an award-winning Australian blues/roots singer and songwriter, solo artist, and cabaret performer. With her charismatic stage presence and powerhouse delivery, the husky-voiced chanteuse has drawn comparisons with Janis Joplin and Bonnie Raitt. Absolutely at home on the stage, with her irreverent wit and deft lyricist, Marisa has audiences in stitches one minute, and moved to tears the next.

artists.name: O'Shea-Ryan Irish Dancers
artists.summary: Recently returned from brilliant performances overseas at International Festivals in Portugal and Romania, where they were honoured by being invited as Special Guests to the Festivals, the O’Shea-Ryan Irish Dancers are once again looking forward to performing at the 2018 Yackandandah Folk Festival.

artists.name: The Ladybirds
artists.summary: Yackandandah's own Meredith Greenwood and Tijana Simic can pollinate the air with the magic of music. Start your day with a colourful dusting of song dance and play.

artists.name: Earth Hour
artists.summary: Join us again for Earth Hour at the Public Hall. Once the lights will go out you will be treated to 10 surprise acts, completely acoustic, in the dark.

artists.name: Georgia & Garry Rose
artists.summary: Georgia and Garry Rose are a family duo that features Golden Fiddle winner 21 yo. Georgia playing a scintillating range of Celtic and European tunes from mesmerizing airs and waltzes to breathtaking jigs and reels. Accompanied by her dad, Garry, who's captivating and diverse songs will have you laughing, crying or singing along.

artists.name: Darcy Johan
artists.summary: Darcy is the rising talent in the region having won the Yackoustic competition in the Shed in 2017

artists.name: Forgotten Land
artists.summary: David and Gem love their music playing at sessions and other outlets. In 2018 they took a big step in launching further into music winning the seniors busking competition at YFF

artists.name: Gordon Mullen
artists.summary: Singer/songwriter, accompanying self on Keyboard. The keyboard is a workstation so I pre-record tracks. So I accompany myself! It's a bit like a backing track. A number of songs have no extra accompaniment.

artists.name: Krazy Koala
artists.summary: The Krazy Koala puppet show combines music and puppetry to produce a truly unique show for kids. The show includes stories, live didgeridoo, audience interraction, dance and plenty of laughter.

artists.name: Vanessa Delaine
artists.summary: Vanessa Delaine is a Wodonga based Singer/Songwriter blessed with a voice that leaves audiences breathless, accompanied by Allans Flat guitarist Michael Barnard, known for his howling blues riffs & wicked blues harp. This duo is making waves internationally having won multiple awards for their Runaway Album and newly released Wild & Free Album.

artists.name: Yackandandah Community Choir
artists.summary: When a village with a population of less than 1000 can muster more than 120 to 150 voices to rehearse and perform together for the community's folk festival, it says something about the unique strength and community capacity in Yackandandah. This much loved group has put together a rousing and harmonious repertoire guaranteed to allow you to finish off the festival on a high. All credit to the wonderful choir and the energetic committee. An unticketed event; all are welcome to come and share the love as they lift spirits and lift the roof.

artists.name: Alawishus Jones & the Outright Lies
artists.summary: Alawishus Jones & the Outright Lies - a high energy, foot stompin', thigh slappin', sashay back through time. Turn of the century, pre-war folk/blues spi'tuals and songs in ragged time.

artists.name: Candice McLeod
artists.summary: Endearing folk songbird, Candice McLeod, has lived a full-time touring life on the road for the past four years. From the red dirt of Alice Springs, salty seas of the east, and the rolling hills in between, Yackandandah has managed to nestle its way as a home in Candice's heart and folk songs. Recent festival performances include Yackandandah Folk Fest 2016/17 and Bendigo Blues and Roots Festival.

artists.name: Faith I Branko
artists.summary: Serbia’s No. 1 Roma violinist and UK accordionist perform high-energy original Roma/Jazz influenced music with an international quartet/quintet. The duo met in Branko’s Serbian Roma village of Gornja Grabovica in 2009, and – with music as their only tool for communication – began a journey that would lead to the creation of their WOMEX award-winning album ‘Gypsy Lover’, their marriage and their success in international touring and media. Branko taught himself the violin, which became a way out of the extreme health, social and economic problems through which he lived in Serbia; he created his own music – intuitively combining sounds of Jazz, Indian, Turkish and Classical music with his Roma traditions. Now based in London, the duo are currently touring with their quartet and quintet.
